Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

Kit assembly recipe that combines individual fastener components into organized
mixed kit. Most commonly used kit in KB (107 BOMs reference this item).
Sorting ensures user can quickly find needed size without having to maintain
separate inventory of each fastener size.

casting+machining+kitting approach without separate component recipes.

steps.notes: Cast fastener blanks and washer stock in batch molds
Machine threads and washer profiles from cast blanks
Heat treat fasteners for strength and spring properties
Inspect heat-treated fasteners for hardness and dimensional checks
Sort fasteners by size (M6, M8, M10, M12), count, and kit

recipe_def.assumptions:
Simplified fastener manufacturing from metal alloy bulk to finished kit:
- Cast blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
- Machine threads and profiles
- Heat treat for strength and spring properties
- Final inspection and kitting

Input materials: 2.0 kg steel_stock
Output: 1.0 kg complete fastener kit per BOM specification
Scrap rate: ~50% from casting/machining losses (conservative placeholder)
recipe_def.notes:
Simplified local recipe for fastener_kit_medium production.

Kit composition per bom_fastener_kit_medium_v0:
- 720g hex bolts M6-M12 in various lengths (76 pieces total)
- 180g hex nuts M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 75g flat washers M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 30g lock washers M6-M12 (60 pieces total)
Total: ~366 fasteners, 1.0 kg net weight

Manufacturing process details:
1. Casting: Form blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
2. Threading: Cut external threads on bolts, tap nuts
3. Heat treatment: Quench and temper bolts to grade 8.8 equivalent, harden lock washers
4. Inspection: Verify hardness and dimensional checks
5. Kitting: Sort by size, verify counts, package in compartmented container
References detailed specification in design/memos/fastener_kit_specification.md
Most commonly used fastener kit in the KB (107 BOMs reference this item)

steps.notes: Extract alumina from highland regolith using HCl leaching

recipe_def.notes: Alumina extraction from lunar highland regolith. Produces 12 kg alumina per 100 kg regolith input.
Carbon anode material produced from methane pyrolysis; placeholder path to close no_recipe gap.
Carbon anode produced from carbon_anode_material via forming; accounts for pitch residue losses.
Synthetic production of cryolite_flux via NaOH + Al2O3 + fluorite; placeholder numbers for early modeling.
recipe_def.name: Cryolite flux synthesis recipe (synthetic) v0

steps.notes: Hall-Hroult electrolysis at ~960C. Very energy-intensive (15 kWh/kg)

inputs.notes: Aluminum oxide extracted from highland regolith
Flux to lower melting point (~90% recycled)

recipe_def.assumptions:
Hall-Hroult process produces aluminum suitable for structural applications.
Cryolite flux is 90% recyclable. Carbon anode consumption rate is 0.5 kg per kg aluminum.
Energy requirement: 15 kWh/kg is realistic for electrolytic aluminum production.
recipe_def.notes:
Aluminum alloy ingot production via Hall-Hroult electrolysis from alumina.

This is the standard industrial process for primary aluminum production.
Extremely energy-intensive (15 kWh/kg output) but enables local aluminum
production from lunar highland regolith.

Process chain from regolith:
1. Highland regolith (100 kg)  alumina extraction  12 kg alumina
2. Alumina (2 kg)  Hall-Hroult smelting  1 kg aluminum ingot
3. Therefore: ~17 kg regolith  1 kg aluminum ingot

Replaces placeholder recipe that incorrectly used generic melting/casting.
Placeholder recipe: produces aluminum_wire from regolith_metal_crude via wire_drawing_aluminum_v0 (ISRU metal -> wire + scrap).

Wind aluminum wire with insulation into motor coils. 28.4 kg wire + 1.4 kg insulation  27 kg coils + 2.8 kg scrap.
Form steel motor housing from iron. 19.2 kg iron  18 kg housing + 1.2 kg scrap.

recipe_def.assumptions: Non-versioned fastener kit assembled from same process steps as v0; includes large bolts, nuts, washers in M16-M30 range
recipe_def.notes: Recipe for fastener_kit_large (non-versioned) derived from v0.

steps.notes: Fabricate thick steel shell sections/stiffeners/support frame with tuyeres and tap hole openings, install refractory brick/castable lining with anchors and sealing, integrate blower/charging system/tuyeres/tap hole assembly/cooling jacket/exhaust handling, final sealing/gasketing/sensor mounting and mechanical checks

recipe_def.assumptions: 5000 kg furnace; coarse cycle times; blower/charging/exhaust treated as subassemblies from BOM.
recipe_def.notes: Build sequence: steel shell fabrication  refractory lining  hardware integration  sealing/inspection.

recipe_def.assumptions: Assemble per BOM; parts produced via part-level routes.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse assembly route; add detailed steps later.

steps.notes: Form regolith-based insulation into panels/blankets and kit into a high-temp pack.

recipe_def.assumptions: Regolith-based insulation can be formed into high-temperature panels with adequate thermal performance.
recipe_def.notes: Local alternative to ceramic fiber-based insulation pack using regolith-derived insulation.
recipe_def.name: High-temp insulation pack from regolith-based insulation

recipe_def.assumptions: Assemble per BOM; parts produced via part-level routes.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse assembly route; add detailed steps later.

steps.notes: Fabricate sand casting flasks from steel angle or flat stock
Machine permanent mold cavities, gating systems, parting lines
Carve or turn wooden casting patterns for various part geometries
Assemble casting equipment set, organize patterns and flasks

recipe_def.assumptions: Sand flasks fabricated from steel. Permanent molds machined with cavities. Wooden patterns carved or turned.
recipe_def.notes: Complete casting mold set with sand flasks, permanent molds, and pattern equipment for metal casting.
Bootstrap production path for mare regolith using the simple mining process.

steps.notes: Extract ilmenite from regolith; yields generated in process.

recipe_def.assumptions: Extraction yields ~0.6 kg ilmenite per 1 kg regolith input; tailings ~0.4 kg.
recipe_def.notes: In-situ ilmenite extraction from regolith; placeholder yields and mass balance.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ilmenite extraction from regolith

steps.notes: Collection of carbonaceous chondrite regolith from meteorite impact sites. Rare (1-2% of lunar surface) but critical for carbon and volatile extraction. Slower than generic mining due to site prospecting and travel.

recipe_def.notes:
Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

steps.notes: Extract carbon reductant from carbonaceous regolith feedstock.

recipe_def.assumptions: Carbonaceous regolith feedstock available for small-scale carbon recovery.
recipe_def.notes: ISRU extraction route for carbon reductant; drying and sizing steps deferred.

recipe_def.assumptions: Local production path added; replace import placeholder with real production pathway.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing recipe for carbon reducing agent using carbon_reductant input.

steps.notes: Single-step carbothermal reduction from ore to iron pig/ingot.

recipe_def.notes: Direct path from iron ore/ilmenite to iron_pig_or_ingot using the iron_smelting_reduction_v0 process.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for iron pig or ingot

recipe_def.assumptions: Pig iron to steel ingot via refining to billet/slab then casting to ingot.
recipe_def.notes: Simplified steel ingot production path.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel ingot v0

steps.notes: Heat steel ingot or billet to rolling temperature (1100-1250C)
Hot roll to plate or sheet thickness with multiple passes

recipe_def.assumptions: Steel plate/sheet production from steel ingots via hot rolling. Plate is >6mm thick, sheet is <6mm. Pickling or cold rolling can be added for improved surface finish and dimensional control. QA inspection omitted here to avoid circular dependency on finished_part.
recipe_def.notes: Steel plate and sheet stock for fabrication, structural components, and enclosures. Surface treatment not yet modeled explicitly.

steps.notes: Mine mare regolith from surface
Screen and separate size fractions
Crush and grind coarse regolith to powder
Extract oxygen and produce metal byproduct via MRE

recipe_def.assumptions: Co-product metal alloy from MRE; refining not modeled.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse route; add refining/separation later.

steps.notes: Cut steel angle iron or tubing for flask frame members
Weld cope and drag frames with alignment pins and handles
Machine alignment surfaces and pin locations for precise mating

recipe_def.assumptions: Steel frame flasks in various sizes. Cope and drag frames mate precisely with alignment pins.
recipe_def.notes: Sand casting flask set for foundry work. Holds sand molds during pouring operations.

steps.notes: Prepare sand mold for casting steel blocks
Cast steel blocks for permanent molds
Machine cavities and surfaces into permanent mold set

recipe_def.assumptions: Cast steel mold blocks then machine cavities; coarse times.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse route; add heat treatment/surface finishing later.

steps.notes: Fabricate sand casting flasks from steel angle or flat stock
Machine permanent mold cavities, gating systems, parting lines
Carve or turn wooden casting patterns for various part geometries
Assemble casting equipment set, organize patterns and flasks

recipe_def.assumptions: Sand flasks fabricated from steel. Permanent molds machined with cavities. Wooden patterns carved or turned.
recipe_def.notes: Complete casting mold set with sand flasks, permanent molds, and pattern equipment for metal casting.

steps.notes: Mine mare regolith from surface
Screen and separate size fractions
Crush and grind coarse regolith to powder
Extract oxygen and produce metal byproduct via MRE

recipe_def.assumptions: Co-product metal alloy from MRE; refining not modeled.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse route; add refining/separation later.

steps.notes: Cast mold base plate, cavity plates, and ejector components (22 kg raw  21 kg cast with ~5% loss)
Machine mold cavity surfaces, register features, and mounting holes
Polish mold cavity surfaces for clean part release, deburr sharp edges
Assemble mold halves, install alignment pins and ejector mechanism, verify operation

recipe_def.assumptions: Ceramic press/mold set for forming green ceramic parts. Steel construction is adequate - no hardening required since ceramic powder is non-abrasive. Set includes base, top plate, cavity inserts, and simple ejector mechanism.
recipe_def.notes: Total fabrication time ~7 hours. Mold set suitable for slip casting or dry pressing ceramic powder mixtures. Simpler than metal forming dies - no heat treatment needed.

steps.notes: Fabricate reactor vessel from steel plate via welding, machine vessel openings for instrumentation and piping, install temperature sensors and pressure gauges, assemble inlet/outlet piping and fittings, apply high-temperature insulation, final assembly and pressure testing

recipe_def.notes:
Basic chemical reactor assembly from welded steel vessel.
500 kg machine for molten salt electrolysis and chemical processing.
Stub machine created during ADR 003 migration - detailed BOM to be defined.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for chemical reactor basic

recipe_def.notes: Bootstrap production path for mare regolith using the simple mining process.

steps.notes: Cast machine base, column, and table from cast iron for vibration damping and rigidity (total ~600-800 kg castings)
Precision machine all mating surfaces, linear guide ways, spindle housing bore, and mounting surfaces; scrape ways to precision tolerances (0.005 mm)
Fabricate and weld structural support frame, coolant tank, chip guard, and enclosure panels
Install linear guides and ball screws on X/Y/Z axes, mount servo motors and encoders, install spindle assembly with bearings, integrate coolant system
Wire CNC controller to servo drives and motors, install limit switches and home sensors, integrate spindle control and tool changer, connect operator panel
Align axes for perpendicularity and parallelism (within 0.01 mm), level machine base, adjust backlash in ball screws
Program test toolpaths, verify axis motion and positioning accuracy, test spindle operation and tool changing, run test parts
Calibrate axes using laser interferometer or precision gauge blocks, tune servo parameters for optimal performance
Verify positioning accuracy (0.01-0.02 mm), repeatability, surface finish capability, and safety interlocks

recipe_def.assumptions: CNC milling machine for automated precision machining. 1200 kg system with cast iron base/column/table for rigidity. 3-axis (X/Y/Z) motion control with ball screws and linear guides. Spindle speeds 100-10,000+ RPM, power 3-7.5 kW. Travel typically 500x400x400 mm. Includes CNC controller (3+ axis), servo motors with encoders, automatic tool changer (optional), coolant system, and chip guard. Positioning accuracy 0.01-0.02 mm.
recipe_def.notes: Assembly of CNC milling machine. Total fabrication time ~155 hours. Extensive precision machining of base components, complex mechanical and electrical integration, and rigorous alignment/calibration required. Critical machine tool for precision manufacturing and prototyping. Much more complex than manual milling machine due to CNC control system and automated features.
